column4: most people do not want to read links to try and help you. Just give a brief summary please.
this assumes your language is set as English
does aticonfig --list-adapters   return a result? I do not need that result... I just need to know it does not cry about no suitable adapter.
aticonfig --initial --input=/etc/X11/xorg.conf          and reboot. I will be here.
I get this result: Uninitialised file found, configuring.
do not put more than one liners in here. Please use sudo before the command.
http://pastebin.com/G0vZ9qmB. Is it what you expected?
you said that previously it was listing the vesa driver. you could lspci -nnk | grep VGA -A2 and see which module is loaded now.
on the terminal it says this http://pastebin.com/aeXEpZif But on he system Details it still says VESA: M92

but my problem is that 720p YouTube videos really lag a lot and I think my graphics card is lacking compatibility with Ubuntu.. What is wrong? Because My Graphics card shouldn't lag with video playback, I used to play Black Ops Multiplayer on it and it did the job. Would updating my kernel get me better performance?
